speaker: BRADDOCK HEIGHTS, MARYLAND; APRIL 27; 10
line: 16 PM

speaker: JOSEPH PATNIK
line: All right, you bastard. Evil... rotten... son of a... There you go! Your killing days are over! No... no! No!

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Put your hands in the air. Keep them where I can see them. We got a call. You want to tell us what you're doing out here? Sir?

speaker: OFFICER #2
line: Turn over. Damn amp-head.

speaker: OFFICER #1
line: Oh lord... Jimmy, check this out.

speaker: JOSEPH PATNIK
line: Sarah? Sarah!

speaker: WASHINGTON, D.C.; APRIL 29; 2
line: 12 AM

speaker: MULDER
line: Our blind date's not off to a good start. I've been waiting here nearly two hours.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: I was asked to make sure you weren't followed.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's just you, me, and the drug dealers.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: This area's always been known for it's criminal element.

speaker: MULDER
line: Especially when Congress is in session. What's this?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: Something you'll want to follow.

speaker: MULDER
line: Follow where?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: That's all I have for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean, that's all you have for me? I get an anonymous e-mail to come meet you here in the middle of the night, I don't know who you are or what you want.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: I don't have any obligation or desire to give you any answers. I'm not one of your sources.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then you're just a messenger boy?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: It's late, Agent Mulder. Go home. Get some sleep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who told you to contact me? How do I know I'm not being played?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: I guess you don't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then you can go ahead and recycle that, then.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: I've been asked to tell you... you walk away from this, more people will die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry, I would've gotten here sooner but the Beltway was a parking lot. What's going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Multiple homicide, a bizarre one. That's Joseph Patnik. He murdered five people, all of whom he insists was the same man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he claims to have been killing the same man over and over again, that he wouldn't die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Does he have a history of mental illness?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not that I know, but I only just got this case yesterday.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, what's the X-File?

speaker: MULDER
line: In Patnik's neighborhood two weeks ago, a baby-sitter attacked the two children she was minding. She told the police she thought they were wolves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And police found no other motive for either of these attacks?

speaker: MULDER
line: Not so far, no.

speaker: STROMAN
line: Agent Mulder? Hi, I'm Doctor Stroman.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Stroman, this is my partner, Special Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi.

speaker: STROMAN
line: Hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're the physician in charge?

speaker: STROMAN
line: Yeah, they called me in from D.C. to try and develop a clear diagnosis for the court.

speaker: MULDER
line: Have you?

speaker: STROMAN
line: I wish I could say "yes."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has he been sedated?

speaker: STROMAN
line: I've got him on heavy thorazine, but it only seemed to knock him back a notch or two.

speaker: MULDER
line: He seems pretty manageable to me.

speaker: STROMAN
line: It may be some form of organic delusional syndrome, possibly due to chronic metamphetamine abuse. I don't know, but, uh, he is prone to outbursts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who called you down on this case?

speaker: STROMAN
line: A Doctor Kahn from the, uh, Department of Social Health Services.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could we speak to him?

speaker: STROMAN
line: I don't think he's in today, but I can certainly check for you. Orderly!

speaker: ORDERLY #1
line: Take it easy...

speaker: ORDERLY #2
line: Calm down, Mister Patnik.

speaker: JOSEPH PATNIK
line: No! No! No, no, no! He's here!

speaker: TELEVISION NEWSCASTER
line: ...Miriskovic personally ordered the rape and murder of thousands of innocent civilians in wartorn regions of the former Yugoslavia. Reporting...

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said you got this case last night, where did it come from?

speaker: MULDER
line: Came from an outside source.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who? This outside source, Mulder, what's his interest in this case? What does he want us to uncover?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you're not suspicious that we're being used?

speaker: MULDER
line: We've got dead bodies and confessed murderers. If we're being used, it's to find out the connection. That's what I'm interested in. Isn't this a school day?

speaker: BOY #1
line: We didn't cut.

speaker: BOY #2
line: We got a pass.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got a pass to come in here and eat these people's food and watch their TV?

speaker: BOY #1
line: No.

speaker: BOY #2
line: Are we in trouble now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How'd you get in here?

speaker: BOY#1
line: Through the window. They leave it open for the cat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe you should head back to school. No, no, no, use the front door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. Look at this, there must be hundreds of videos here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything good?

speaker: SCULLY
line: All I see are recordings of cable news shows. They're all dated and in chronological order. You know, that's what Patnik was watching at the hospital when he went all wiggy. What if there's some connection?

speaker: MULDER
line: Between what he saw and what he recorded and what he did?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're the one who's interested.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just watched thirty-six hours of Bernard Shaw and Bobbie Batista. I'm about ready to kill somebody too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to show you something. These tapes are dated April nineteenth, April twenty-first and April twenty-third. Each corresponds to a night that Patnik committed a murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's on the tapes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Among other things, a one-hour special report on the atrocities in Bosnia, a report that prominently features Lladoslav Miriskovic.

speaker: MULDER
line: The same guy that started Patnik screaming in the psych ward?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And my guess is that once I review the tapes for the night that Patnik killed his wife, that I'll find that report there as well.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you think that because Patnik saw this war criminal on television, he was somehow inspired to go out and murder these people?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, recent studies have linked violence on television to violent behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but those studies are based on the assumption that Americans are just empty vessels ready to be filled with any idea or image that's fed to them like a bunch of Pavlov dogs and go out and act on it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But they believe that the causal connections are there, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: They, studies have also shown causal connections between cow flatulence and the depletion of the ozone layer. What you're talking about is pseudo-science used to make political book.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All I'm saying is that I think it's clear that, that the programs that Patnik watched somehow triggered his violent behavior.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The doctor suggested amphetamine abuse. Maybe that coupled with, with the disturbing images he was watching, pushed him over the edge.

speaker: MULDER
line: All I know is television does not make a previously sane man go out and kill five people, thinking they're all the same guy. Not even "Must-See TV" could do that to you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, then how do you explain it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't. Not yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to get some sleep. Looks like you could use some too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I'm going to... watch the rest of these tapes. Just out of curiosity.

speaker: MULDER
line: You have fun. Yes. I understand. All right. I've just been watching the tapes. I'll come outside. Right. Okay. No, she doesn't. No. Goodbye.

speaker: APRIL 20; 9
line: 48 AM

speaker: GAME SHOW HOST
line: Before we go any further, I'd like to... This beautiful washer-dryer! Tell them about it, Colonel.

speaker: GAME SHOW ANNOUNCER
line: This beautiful washer-dryer...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just got a call. There's been another murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, I'll be right there.

speaker: MULDER
line: It happened just less than an hour ago. It seems to match our pattern, a housewife gone berserk.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The car's been moved. Did you take it out last night?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Uh, I went out, and I got a paper this morning. Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing. Nothing, let's go see the crime scene.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, thanks, Detective.

speaker: DETECTIVE
line: You're welcome. I just talked to the detective in charge. The shooter is Helene Riddock, age forty-two. They took her to lock-up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: She looked out the window and claims she saw her husband in the hammock... with a blonde.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That blonde?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, apparently, he was only taking a nap with his dog... But Mrs. Riddock swears she looked out the window and saw her husband in the hammock with a blonde woman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, this woman killed her husband because she thought he was cheating on her?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is not even her husband. Her husband's a long-haul trucker. He's been out of town for the last ten days. Mister John Gillness, it's her next-door neighbor. She didn't even have the right backyard. Helene Riddock lives over here. Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, let's check it out.

speaker: TELEVISION ANNOUNCER
line: One of my favorites, he is so cute. "The Little Traveler," normally a hundred-and-twenty-nine and that's what you're going to pay at the department stores, but here at Home Value Network...

speaker: MULDER
line: "A thing of beauty is a joy forever..." what do you think, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think television plays a large part in both of these murderers' lives.

speaker: MULDER
line: As it does in almost every American home, but television does not equal violence. I don't care what anybody says... Unless you consider bad taste an act of violence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More tapes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hang on a second. I'll be right back. Hey! Hey! Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm coming down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found a cable trapper scrambler running from the pole into the house.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe it's a job for Special Agent Pendrell and the Sci-Crime lab. You want it analyzed?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I'll do it. It makes more sense for you to go down and interview Helene Riddock. Get her version of the story. Maybe she knows what this thing is. Is there a problem with that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, that's, that's fine, I'm...

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay in touch.

speaker: BYERS
line: It looks a lot like a standard video trap for blocking premium cable channels.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does this one block?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Amazingly, it doesn't seem to block anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what does it do?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Glad you asked.

speaker: MULDER
line: I bet all you guys were officers in the audio-visual club in high school, huh?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Mm-hmmm.

speaker: BYERS
line: This is the straight feed off our bars and tone generator... And here are the bars and tone as attenuated through the device.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks the same.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Well, that's what you'd think.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We couldn't discern any difference between the feeds, not until we compared them on the oscilloscope.

speaker: MULDER
line: Still looks the same.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hold onto your hat, dude. We have touchdown.

speaker: MULDER
line: So they're different. So... they're different.

speaker: BYERS
line: You know the way television works?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, you click it on, you have a picture.

speaker: LANGLY
line: It's a rapid series of still pictures fired against the tube.

speaker: BYERS
line: There's something non-standard here......in the vertical blanking interval, information that's being added into the spaces between the still pictures.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of information?

speaker: BYERS
line: We don't know.

speaker: LANGLY
line: This is as far as we could get with this equipment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, can you take it apart?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Not without destroying it completely. That's by design.

speaker: BYERS
line: An amazingly sophisticated design, but all we can say for sure is...

speaker: MULDER
line: This device is emitting a signal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was just about to call you. Look, I'm on my way back. You may have been right, Scully, at least partly. I think there is a foreign signal being introduced into these people's homes through the television set. Scully, are you there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think they may be running some kind of test. Scully, did you hear what I just said?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, you had it analyzed?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just talked to Agent Pendrell, he said that you never showed up.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't take it over to Pendrell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then where were you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, I'd, I'd rather talk about it when we get on the land line, okay? We've dealt with these kind of people before. We know what they're capable of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was that?

speaker: MULDER
line: What was what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There, that noise.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, is there something wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... Mulder, who's listening to...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look, I'm going to be right there, okay? Don't go anywhere. Don't...

speaker: MULDER
line: Here, she's in here. Ready?

speaker: PROPREITOR
line: Ready. On the count...

speaker: MULDER
line: Wait... Get back, call the police. Scully! Scully!

speaker: MAY 1; 6
line: 04 AM

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Scully, hi, it's Fox Mulder.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What is it, what's the matter?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was hoping that you'd heard from Dana.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: No. Has something happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm... I'm not exactly sure. There's... there's some confusion here. She's missing.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: What do you mean, "missing?"

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, she ran off last night. Um... we, we, we're looking for her as best we can......but we are a little concerned.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Oh my God...

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Mrs. Scully, I hate to do this to you, but I got to hang up on you right now.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Fox, would you please tell me what's wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hang by the phone. I will call you as soon as I know something. Sir, can I have a word with you? This manhunt is being conducted as if we're searching for an escaped convict.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Mulder, I share your concern for Agent Scully, but the fact remains she fired four rounds at you and an unarmed civilian last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: I appreciate that, but these officers should be instructed not to confront her once they find her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What would you have them do?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just to keep an eye on her till I can get there. I think I can get her to listen to me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She didn't listen to you last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's because she's not responsible for her own actions. She's suffering from some kind of paranoid psychosis.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Brought on by what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't explain the exact mechanism, but it has something to do with certain videotapes we watched that we recovered from a crime scene.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Videotapes?

speaker: MULDER
line: Videotapes that contain an electronic signal that somehow induces violent behavior.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you have any proof of this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm working on that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Whatever prompted her behavior, the fact remains that Scully is armed and obviously dangerous so I suggest you Marshall whatever resources you have to make sure that you find her first.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Mulder, we pulled something off that videotape you found in Scully's room.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Something interesting... but we don't want to talk about it......over the phone. "Big Brother" may be listening.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Here's the tape Scully was reviewing last night. We scanned samples of the tape onto disk.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Digitized it.

speaker: BYERS
line: Using some interpolating freeware we pulled off the net, we were able to blank out visible frames.

speaker: MULDER
line: What am I looking at?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Well, this is the actual signal your cable trap device was emitting.

speaker: BYERS
line: Of course, we slowed it down significantly. It's designed to cycle at fifteen flashes per second to induce what is known as the "photic driving response."

speaker: MULDER
line: Bring it home, boys.

speaker: LANGLY
line: This device is stimulating electrical activity in the brain.

speaker: BYERS
line: Studies into subliminal influence have shown a correlation between heightened suggestibility and the manipulation of this response.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mind control?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Fifty-seven channels of it.

speaker: BYERS
line: Tachistoscophic images, like they used to sell popcorn at the movies. Both Russian and American scientists have been working with it for decades.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Not to mention Madison Avenue.

speaker: MULDER
line: The naked lady in the ice cube.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Ah, one of my personal favorites.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why wasn't I affected?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: That's the one thing we haven't figured out yet.

speaker: MULDER
line: This, uh... subliminal signal, could color be a factor in it?

speaker: BYERS
line: Maybe.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm red-green color blind.

speaker: BYERS
line: His inability to perceive the color red could render him immune to the psychotropic effects.

speaker: LANGLY
line: But why design a color-dependent signal?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Why not? Red-green color blind...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder....affects only a small percentage of the male population.

speaker: BYERS
line: Which still leaves the vast majority of the American public vulnerable to it's effects.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll be right there.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maryland State Police. They think they've found Scully.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Is she okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, um... they think maybe I should come down and I.D. the body.

speaker: FREDERICK COUNTY MORGUE; 6
line: 21 PM

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: Get in.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't talk to you right now.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: They're watching you. Now, get in before you get us both killed.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's an interesting choice of words. My partner may be dead.

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: It's not my concern.

speaker: MULDER
line: The hell it isn't! We're here because of you!

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: Keep your voice down.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you, who do you work for?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: You're wasting time. While you're chasing your partner, they're destroying the evidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: PLAIN-CLOTHED MAN
line: Just follow the evidence. If you don't, by tomorrow, the responsible parties will be out of your reach.

speaker: CORONER
line: State highway patrolman found the body off a rural highway Are you ready?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me do that. It's not her. Somebody has to call her mother.

speaker: CORONER
line: We already tried. We weren't able to reach her.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's not answering her phone?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Scully, is she here?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Uh, no.

speaker: MULDER
line: You haven't been answering your phone.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Well, when I hear from her, I'll call you, okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: I need to see her.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Fox, please, go away... Go away!

speaker: MULDER
line: Sorry. Where is she?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana, put down the gun!

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm here to help you, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told you, Mom. He's here to kill me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm on your side, you know that.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Put it down, Dana.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, listen to me very carefully. You don't know it, but you're sick with the same thing that drove those other people to murder... and whatever you think may be happening...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just step back.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana, you're not yourself. He's telling you the truth.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not the truth, Mom. He's lied to me from the beginning. He's never trusted me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you are the only one I trust.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're in on it. You're one of them. You're one of the people who abducted me. You put that thing in my neck. You killed my sister!

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: That's not true, Dana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It is.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: I want you to listen to me...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mom, just get out of the way!

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: You trust me, don't you? You know that I would never hurt you. That I would never let anybody hurt you. That's why you came here, isn't it? You're safe here. Put the gun down, Dana. Put it down. Put the gun down, Dana. Put it down.

speaker: NORTHEAST GEORGETOWN MEDICAL CENTER; MAY 2; 1
line: 43 PM

speaker: TELEVISION NEWSCASTER
line: ...runway 12-H. The runway generally reserved for...

speaker: MULDER
line: How you feeling?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ashamed. I was so sure, Mulder. I saw things and I heard things, and... it was just like world was turned upside-down. Everybody was out to get me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now you know how I feel most of the time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you were going to kill me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not surprised. I did some checking. Joseph Patnik thought he was murdering a Bosnian war criminal, a man the media described as a modern-day Hitler. It turns out both Patnik's parents were Holocaust survivors.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not following.

speaker: MULDER
line: Helen Riddock was scared her husband was going to be unfaithful to her. You see a pattern developing here? What if this, this video signal somehow turned these people's anxieties into some kind of dementia? Yeah, a, a virtual reality of their own worst nightmares?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like me thinking that you'd betray me. I was so far gone, Mulder, I thought that you had gone to the other side.

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That Cancer Man, the man who smokes all those cigarettes, I was sure that I saw the two of you sitting in your car in the motel parking lot. You were reporting to him, you handed him a videotape. I'm... it was crazy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, maybe not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, somebody's behind this, we just don't know who.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think it could be him?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Why don't you try to get some rest? Doctor Lorenz?

speaker: LORENZ
line: Agent Mulder. I was just about to check in on your partner.

speaker: MULDER
line: What, uh, course of treatment have you outlined for Agent Scully?

speaker: LORENZ
line: At this point, nothing more than bed rest. We still haven't been able to determine what brought this on. As far as I can tell, there's nothing medically wrong with her.

speaker: MULDER
line: That didn't seem to be the case last night.

speaker: LORENZ
line: No, it wasn't. It's got me puzzled. Her M.R.I. was negative, but the spinal tap revealed high levels of serotonin in her brain.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think that would account for her strange behavior?

speaker: LORENZ
line: High serotonin levels have been associated with mania. But the good news is, as of this afternoon, her levels are pretty much back to normal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Doctor Lorenz, uh... Would you have made a diagnosis of amphetamine abuse for someone in Agent Scully's condition?

speaker: LORENZ
line: Not given her serotonin levels, no. That wouldn't make any sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you. Braddock Heights. Yeah, I need the number for Frederick County Psychiatric Hospital, please.

speaker: NURSE
line: Ward three.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, this is Fox Mulder with the Federal Bureau of Investigation. I need to talk to Doctor Stroman, please.

speaker: NURSE
line: I'm sorry, Doctor Stroman's no longer here. I believe he's returned to Washington.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know where I can reach him?

speaker: NURSE
line: Um, I'm not sure... he left us a local number. It's around here somewhere...

speaker: NURSE
line: That's it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You want me to go first this time?

speaker: PROPRIETOR
line: You're damn straight. I haven't had a chance to clean the room yet. He just checked out. What with all the excitement, I don't blame him.

speaker: MULDER
line: You charge for local calls?

speaker: PROPRIETOR
line: Of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: You'd have a record of all calls made...

speaker: PROPRIETOR
line: I'll get it for you. Here you go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks. Thank you. Hey, Danny, it's Mulder. I need you to check a number for me.

speaker: CABLE TECHNICIAN
line: That's what he told me, Stroman.

speaker: STROMAN
line: Then where is he? He said he'd be here by now.

speaker: CABLE TECHNICIAN
line: He'll be here.

speaker: STROMAN
line: It's almost seven o'clock. There's no sign of him.

speaker: X
line: You're too late, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Now that you've destroyed all the evidence.

speaker: X
line: You were told this would happen. You made your choice.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just didn't know I was working for you.

speaker: X
line: I had no alternative. I was being watched too closely. I couldn't risk compromising myself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why kill them if you wanted me to expose them?

speaker: X
line: Those were always my orders, Agent Mulder. I was just hoping you'd get to them first.

speaker: MULDER
line: And uncover what? What were they trying to do, manipulate people's behavior? Alter their decision making-process? What to buy, who to vote for?

speaker: X
line: You think they'll stop at commerce and politics?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where will they stop?

speaker: X
line: That's where you failed, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't lay this off on me, you sneaky son of a bitch. You pulled me into this situation because you didn't have the courage to reveal the truth yourself.

speaker: X
line: Feel better now?

speaker: MULDER
line: You're a coward! You work in the shadows, you feed me scraps of information, hoping that I can piece it together. You make me risk my life, you risk my partner's life and you never risk your own! You're not walking away from this.

speaker: X
line: You're risking your life right now. You failed. This is your success? Killing me? The truth is... you need me, Agent Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is your final report, Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I see more questions than I do answers. You don't know who manufactured the device you found or what its purpose was.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, welcome back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry I'm late, I just got back from the document section.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What did you find out about the two men Mulder found executed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The cable company employee had no criminal record. In fact, there was nothing remarkable about him whatsoever. We found a medical license under the name "Doctor Stroman" in Falls Church, Virginia. He died in 1978.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What about their killer?

speaker: MULDER
line: He remains an unknown subject.

speaker: CSM
line: Have you completed your work?

speaker: X
line: All the personnel and hardware have been removed, but Mulder still has one of the devices.

speaker: CSM
line: Oh, it proves nothing. What about, uh... Mulder's source?

speaker: X
line: He's been eliminated.

speaker: CSM
line: And his source? Who's he working with?

speaker: X
line: That person remains unknown.
